sentence.text: Renee shot a disapproving glance at Knocker and began preparing her drink .
I do n't drink much of my beer , partly due to a disapproving glance from Willie , and partly because I want to leave it under my chair for Jerry to have later .
` Apart from the hate mail in his sock drawer , " he added , casting a disapproving glance at Bridget .
Oh , please take that disapproving look off your face .
Blondel gave him a disapproving look .
“ And now , ” she said in curt dismissal , “ as I can see that you have an awful lot to do around here … ” she gave the dirty coffee-mug a disapproving look “ …
Laura scolded in a disapproving tone .
Finding her voice at last , and reacting to his disapproving tone , she retorted , ` What were you doing , following me ? "
In south Yorkshire during the forties , we were particularly disapproving of the sort of woman who ` puts on every bit of cheap jewellery that she 's got " .
Descended from a devoutly religious family , he was mildly disapproving of Iran 's high society pleasure-seekers .
` Is that why you were so disapproving of my apparent readiness to exploit your father 's generosity towards me ? "
` What do they make at this place ? " asks the disapproving Greek matriarch when her grandson returns from work .
Seen through the disapproving eyes of respectable citizens they were nothing but a disorderly and disorganized rabble , dropouts from the social ladder .
I show the snippet to Tony and the resulting peals of laughter from the pair of us bring disapproving stares from all over the plane .
Women policed each other , stopping rebellious acts with cold and disapproving stares .
Above the sink was a large cupboard which she opened despite the disapproving suck of John 's tongue .
It comes as no surprise to … science , ” she said with a disapproving emphasis upon the final word .
` Oh , come on , do n't be so disapproving .
